p: The content of α-acids in different hop varieties also determines the content of xanthohumol, the main polyphenol in hops [ 8]. When exposed to high temperatures (100–130 °C) and pH (8–10) as in the case of hop boiling during the brewing process, alpha-acids isomerize to iso-α-acids that next to oxidized hop acids—humulinones—predominantly to provide the bitter taste of beer [ 34, 72]. As a majority of hops is grown for the brewing industry, its price is proportional to the alpha-acid content [ 60].
